--- title: SPEDAS.jl subtitle: Space data analysis toolbox in Julia date: last-modified categories: - package - Julia format: html: toc-location: left code-links: - text: GitHub Repo href: https://github.com/Beforerr/SPEDAS.jl icon: github - text: Documentation href: https://beforerr.github.io/SPEDAS.jl/dev/ icon: globe engine: julia --- Think of `SPEDAS` in Julia. ## Installation ::: {#2 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} using Pkg Pkg.add(["Speasy", "SPEDAS", "DimensionalData", "Dates", "Unitful", "LinearAlgebra", "CairoMakie"]) Pkg.add(url="https://github.com/Beforerr/Beforerr.jl") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: # Getting data is easy ::: {#4 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} using Speasy using Dates using DimensionalData using CairoMakie using SPEDAS using Unitful using LinearAlgebra const spz = speasy ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ``` Python: ``` ::: ::: ::: {#6 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} t0 = DateTime("2008-09-05T10:00:00") t1 = DateTime("2008-09-05T22:00:00") da = get_data("cda/THA_L2_FGM/tha_fgs_gse", t0, t1) |> DimArray ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html} 
[ Info: Cannot parse tha_fgs_gse unit nT*GSE*(All*Qs)

``` ::: ::: ::: # Array-like Time Series No more need to `get_data` and `store_data`. All the functions and operations that work on abstract array would also work on the time series. ::: {#8 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} @info da_max = maximum(da) @info norm.(eachrow(da))[1:10] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

t1) |> DimArray try da1 + da2 catch e println(e) @test e isa Unitful.DimensionError end # in different times so add would not work tspan3 = DateTime("2008-09-05T10:00:00"), (`Unitful.jl` integration) ::: {#12 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} @info da_dim = dimension(da.data[1]) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html} 
[ Info: NoDims
``` ::: ::: ::: # Tplot ::: {#14 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} f = tplot(da) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-8-output-1.svg){} ::: ::: ::: {#16 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} figure = (; size=(1200, 800)) tvars = [ "cda/THA_L2_FGM/tha_fgs_gsmQ", "cda/OMNI_HRO_1MIN/flow_speed", "cda/OMNI_HRO_1MIN/E", "cda/OMNI_HRO_1MIN/Pressure", ] tplot(tvars, t0, t1; figure) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-9-output-2.svg){} ::: ::: ## Spectrogram https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/misc/NotesM.html#MMS1_FPI_FAST_L2_DES-DIST ::: {#18 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} ts0 = "2019-01-02T15" |> DateTime ts1 = "2019-01-02T22" |> DateTime tvars = [ "cda/MMS1_FGM_SRVY_L2/mms1_fgm_b_gse_srvy_l2_clean", "cda/MMS1_FPI_FAST_L2_DES-MOMS/mms1_des_energyspectr_omni_fast", ] tplot(tvars, ts0, ts1; add_title=true) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-10-output-2.svg){} ::: ::: ## Overlay plots ::: {#20 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} SDS = SPEDAS.DataSet ts0 = DateTime("2021-01-17") ts1 = DateTime("2021-01-18") density_tvar = SDS( "Density", [ "cda/PSP_SWP_SPI_SF00_L3_MOM/DENS", "cda/PSP_FLD_L3_RFS_LFR_QTN/N_elec", "cda/PSP_FLD_L3_SQTN_RFS_V1V2/electron_density" ] ) tvars = [density_tvar] tplot(tvars, ts0, ts1; add_title=true) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html} 
[ Info: Resampling 24704Ã—1 DimArray{Unitful.Quantity{Float32, ğ‹â»Â³, Unitful.FreeUnits{(cmâ»Â³,), ğ‹â»Â³, nothing}}, 2} DENS along dimension 1 from 24704 to 6070 points
[ Info: Resampling 24272Ã—1 DimArray{Unitful.Quantity{Float32, ğ‹â»Â³, Unitful.FreeUnits{(cmâ»Â³,), ğ‹â»Â³, nothing}}, 2} N_elec along dimension 1 from 24272 to 6070 points
[ Info: Resampling 24282Ã—1 DimArray{Unitful.Quantity{Float32, ğ‹â»Â³, Unitful.FreeUnits{(cmâ»Â³,), ğ‹â»Â³, nothing}}, 2} electron_density along dimension 1 from 24282 to 6070 points
``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-11-output-2.svg){} ::: ::: ## Complex requests and flexible layout ::: {#22 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} data = let intervals = ["2019-01-02T15", "2019-01-02T16"] products = [ spz.inventories.tree.cda.MMS.MMS1.FGM.MMS1_FGM_SRVY_L2.mms1_fgm_b_gse_srvy_l2_clean, spz.inventories.tree.cda.MMS.MMS1.SCM.MMS1_SCM_SRVY_L2_SCSRVY.mms1_scm_acb_gse_scsrvy_srvy_l2, spz.inventories.tree.cda.MMS.MMS1.DES.MMS1_FPI_FAST_L2_DES_MOMS.mms1_des_bulkv_gse_fast, spz.inventories.tree.cda.MMS.MMS1.DES.MMS1_FPI_FAST_L2_DES_MOMS.mms1_des_temppara_fast, spz.inventories.tree.cda.MMS.MMS1.DES.MMS1_FPI_FAST_L2_DES_MOMS.mms1_des_tempperp_fast, spz.inventories.tree.cda.MMS.MMS1.DES.MMS1_FPI_FAST_L2_DES_MOMS.mms1_des_energyspectr_omni_fast, spz.inventories.tree.cda.MMS.MMS1.DIS.MMS1_FPI_FAST_L2_DIS_MOMS.mms1_dis_energyspectr_omni_fast ] get_data(products, intervals) end let figure = (; size=(1200, 1200)), add_title = true f = Figure(; figure...) tplot(f[1, 1], data[1:3]; add_title) tplot(f[1, 2], [data[4:5], data[6:7]...]; add_title) f end ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Can't get MMS1_FGM_SRVY_L2/mms1_fgm_b_gse_srvy_l2_clean without web service, switching to web service ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-12-output-2.svg){} ::: ::: # Disk-cached Time Series WebServer (CDAWeb) -> Files -> Data structure (`tplot` variable / `numpy` array) However, loading `cdf` files is moderately slow, especially for large data. We can improve the performance by disk-caching the data structure (`numpy` array). WebServer (CDAWeb) -> Files -> Disk-cached data structure -> Data structure # Interactive Time Series Use `GLMakie` to zoom in and **Zoom out** to explore data. ::: {#24 .cell execution_count=0} ``` {.julia .cell-code} tplot(tvars, t0, t1; figure) ``` ::: # Multiple dispatch `tplot` > We are power Matlab users. Some of us are Lisp hackers. Some are Pythonistas, others Rubyists, still others Perl hackers. There are those of us who used Mathematica before we could grow facial hair. There are those who still can't grow facial hair. We've generated more R plots than any sane person should. C is our desert island programming language. > We love all of these languages; they are wonderful and powerful. For the work we do â€” scientific computing, machine learning, data mining, large-scale linear algebra, distributed and parallel computing â€” each one is perfect for some aspects of the work and terrible for others. Each one is a trade-off. > We are greedy: we want more. > We want a language that's open source, with a liberal license. We want the speed of C with the dynamism of Ruby. We want a language that's homoiconic, with true macros like Lisp, but with obvious, familiar mathematical notation like Matlab. We want something as usable for general programming as Python, as easy for statistics as R, as natural for string processing as Perl, as powerful for linear algebra as Matlab, as good at gluing programs together as the shell. Something that is dirt simple to learn, yet keeps the most serious hackers happy. We want it interactive and we want it compiled. We want `tplot` to understand a time series represented as a `vector`-like / `matrix`-like (series/heatmap/spectrogram) / `Function` / `String`; We want `tplot` to plot multiple time series on the same figure; We want `tplot` to be interactive as well as publication-ready; and we want `tplot` to be composable. ::: {#26 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} figure = (; size=(1600, 1200)) f = Figure(; figure...) tvars1 = ["cda/OMNI_HRO_1MIN/flow_speed", "cda/OMNI_HRO_1MIN/E", "cda/OMNI_HRO_1MIN/Pressure"] tvars2 = ["cda/THA_L2_FGM/tha_fgs_gse"] tvars3 = ["cda/OMNI_HRO_1MIN/BX_GSE", "cda/OMNI_HRO_1MIN/BY_GSE"] t0 = DateTime("2008-09-05T10:00:00") t1 = DateTime("2008-09-05T22:00:00") tplot(f[1, 1], tvars1, t0, t1) tplot(f[1, 2], tvars2, t0, t1) tplot(f[2, 1:2], tvars3, t0, t1) f ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ::: {.ansi-escaped-output} ```{=html}
